content:
2020-10-15-Patient-Empowerment-Agenda-Patient-Empowerment-Confluence.pdf

We have a new friend joining us - Erin Roche of TaskForce.org! Public health informaticist.

Here are the minutes. LOTS going on, people - here are screen grabs that may inspire some minutes-reading.

There's time-sensitive / crunch-time work happening now, and more -

  • Deadline 1 month from today: The Patient Contributed Data white paper must be submitted Nov 15 for the January ballot.
  • The Patient Corrections project needs THREE work products (use cases, IG proposal & more) completed for the January connectathon
    image.png
    image.png

See also discussion of how we're going to manage the HL7 home/s of the Advance Directive Interop IG project.

Intense discussion on ADI (Advance Directives Interoperability) on today's Pt Empowerment WG call; it's nearly all we talked about. Heavy focus on defining use cases, leading directly (as always) into thorny questions of how much of the mental model (legal, practical etc) to assume or incorporate into standards work.

Preliminary minutes https://confluence.hl7.org/display/PE/2020-10-22+Patient+Empowerment+WG+Minutes ... involved participants will be touching up what got recorded here. @Maria D Moen @Dave Hill perhaps @Jan Oldenburg @Abigail Watson and others
catching up on the stream, thank for this welcome, @Dave deBronkart

Dave deBronkart said:

2020-10-15-Patient-Empowerment-Agenda-Patient-Empowerment-Confluence.pdf

We have a new friend joining us - Erin Roche of TaskForce.org! Public health informaticist.

thanks @Dave deBronkart -

hey @Dave Hill @Maria D Moen I think we would have a number of patient-facing apps in CARIN who would be interested in the advanced directives IG use case. We've spoken to Jeff Zucker about this many times. Let me know if we want to set up some time to discuss.
Hi @Ryan Howells I think it would be great to setup a time to discuss ways we can collaborate. I'll email you.
